page.title: 14THE BUDE COASTLINE
page.content: The coastline around Bude has rugged cliffs which are about 50 meters high and are made of folded rocks.Several caves are found at the foot of the cliffs.In the cliff at Northcott Mouth there is a tunnel carved out of the rock which is said to run about a mile inland.In the past it was used by smugglers for storing {contraband.} The beaches are mainly sandy and are totally covered at high.The rocks on the beach are covered with mussels and bladderwort.The tides are very changeable with{spring tides}being about 5 meters high.When the sea goes out you can see the remains of a submerged forest. Coastal erosion is going on quite rapidly.A bungalow near Northcott Mouth is losing its garden and World War 2 defences have been eaten away.
